title: Varextropy of doubly truncated random variable
authors: Raheleh Zamini, Somayeh Ghafouri, Faranak Goodarzi
abstract:
Recently, there has been growing attention to study uncertainty measures for
doubly truncated random variables. In this paper, the concept of varextropy for
doubly truncated random variables is introduced. The changes of this measure
under linear transforms are investigated. Also, lower and upper bounds for the
interval varextropy under some conditions are obtained and some other
properties for this measure are proved. In the following, three estimators for
the interval varextropy are proposed. A simulation study has been carried out
to investigate the behavior of estimators. At the end, an application for these
estimators is proposed.
